comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The Hoosier Poet James Whitcomb Riley (1849-1916), -- wealthy, wildly popular, alcoholic -- had suffered a stroke in 1910, and in 1913 began using a cane as he learned to walk again. According to a caption in Riley's Wikipedia biography, this photograph was taken at a "Riley Day" celebration in Cincinnati, in November, 1913. Riley's train passed through Cincinnati every year, on the way from his summer home in Greenfield, Indiana, to winter quarters in Florida. Wikipedia on Riley: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Whitcomb_Riley
